title: Nevada Firm Recalls Chicken Products That Were Produced Without Fully Implementing a Ready-To-Eat HACCP Plan
summary: WASHINGTON, July 4, 2014 Kanani Foods, a Las Vegas, Nev. establishment, is recalling approximately 59 pounds of various chicken products because the products were not produced under a fully implemented Ready-To-Eat Hazard Analysis & Critical Control Points (HACCP) plan, the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food...
impacted_products: 12 oz. bowls of  “Teriyaki Chicken Rice Bowls”
12 oz. bowls of “Orange Chicken Rice Bowls”
